refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The GMount interface represents user-visible mounts. Note, when porting from GnomeVFS, GMount is the moral equivalent of GnomeVFSVolume.

GMount is a "mounted" filesystem that you can access. Mounted is in quotes because it's not the same as a unix mount, it might be a gvfs mount, but you can still access the files on it if you use GIO. Might or might not be related to a volume object.

Unmounting a GMount instance is an asynchronous operation. For more information about asynchronous operations, see GAsyncResult and GTask. To unmount a GMount instance, first call g_mount_unmount_with_operation() with (at least) the GMount instance and a GAsyncReadyCallback. The callback will be fired when the operation has resolved (either with success or failure), and a GAsyncResult structure will be passed to the callback. That callback should then call g_mount_unmount_with_operation_finish() with the GMount and the GAsyncResult data to see if the operation was completed successfully. If an error is present when g_mount_unmount_with_operation_finish() is called, then it will be filled with any error information.

refsect2.title: g_mount_get_name ()
refsect2.para: Gets the name of mount .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the name for the given mount . The returned string should be freed with g_free() when no longer needed.

refsect2.title: g_mount_get_uuid ()
refsect2.para: Gets the UUID for the mount . The reference is typically based on the file system UUID for the mount in question and should be considered an opaque string. Returns NULL if there is no UUID available.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the UUID for mount or NULL if no UUID can be computed. The returned string should be freed with g_free() when no longer needed.

refsect2.title: g_mount_get_icon ()
refsect2.para: Gets the icon for mount .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a GIcon. The returned object should be unreffed with g_object_unref() when no longer needed.

refsect2.title: g_mount_get_symbolic_icon ()
refsect2.para: Gets the symbolic icon for mount .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a GIcon. The returned object should be unreffed with g_object_unref() when no longer needed.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.34

refsect2.title: g_mount_get_drive ()
refsect2.para: Gets the drive for the mount .
This is a convenience method for getting the GVolume and then using that object to get the GDrive.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a GDrive or NULL if mount is not associated with a volume or a drive. The returned object should be unreffed with g_object_unref() when no longer needed.

refsect2.title: g_mount_get_root ()
refsect2.para: Gets the root directory on mount .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a GFile. The returned object should be unreffed with g_object_unref() when no longer needed.

refsect2.title: g_mount_get_volume ()
refsect2.para: Gets the volume for the mount .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a GVolume or NULL if mount is not associated with a volume. The returned object should be unreffed with g_object_unref() when no longer needed.

refsect2.title: g_mount_get_default_location ()
refsect2.para: Gets the default location of mount . The default location of the given mount is a path that reflects the main entry point for the user (e.g. the home directory, or the root of the volume).

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a GFile. The returned object should be unreffed with g_object_unref() when no longer needed.

refsect2.title: g_mount_can_unmount ()
refsect2.para: Checks if mount can be unmounted.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the mount can be unmounted.

refsect2.title: g_mount_unmount ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_mount_unmount (GMount *mount, GMountUnmountFlags flags, GCancellable *cancellable, GAsyncReadyCallback callback, gpointer user_data);

warning.para: g_mount_unmount has been deprecated since version 2.22 and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para:
Unmounts a mount. This is an asynchronous operation, and is finished by calling g_mount_unmount_finish() with the mount
and GAsyncResult data returned in the callback .

entry.para: optional GCancellable object, NULL to ignore.

refsect2.title: g_mount_unmount_finish ()

warning.para: g_mount_unmount_finish has been deprecated since version 2.22 and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Finishes unmounting a mount. If any errors occurred during the operation, error will be set to contain the errors and FALSE will be returned.

entry.para: a GError location to store the error occurring, or NULL to ignore.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the mount was successfully unmounted. FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_mount_unmount_with_operation ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_mount_unmount_with_operation (GMount *mount, GMountUnmountFlags flags, GMountOperation *mount_operation, GCancellable *cancellable, GAsyncReadyCallback callback, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para:
Unmounts a mount. This is an asynchronous operation, and is finished by calling g_mount_unmount_with_operation_finish() with the mount
and GAsyncResult data returned in the callback .

entry.para: a GMountOperation or NULL to avoid user interaction.
optional GCancellable object, NULL to ignore.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.22

refsect2.title: g_mount_unmount_with_operation_finish ()
refsect2.para: Finishes unmounting a mount. If any errors occurred during the operation, error will be set to contain the errors and FALSE will be returned.

entry.para: a GError location to store the error occurring, or NULL to ignore.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the mount was successfully unmounted. FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.22

refsect2.title: g_mount_remount ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_mount_remount (GMount *mount, GMountMountFlags flags, GMountOperation *mount_operation, GCancellable *cancellable, GAsyncReadyCallback callback, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para:
Remounts a mount. This is an asynchronous operation, and is finished by calling g_mount_remount_finish() with the mount
and GAsyncResults data returned in the callback .

Remounting is useful when some setting affecting the operation of the volume has been changed, as these may need a remount to take affect. While this is semantically equivalent with unmounting and then remounting not all backends might need to actually be unmounted.

entry.para: a GMountOperation or NULL to avoid user interaction.
optional GCancellable object, NULL to ignore.

refsect2.title: g_mount_remount_finish ()
refsect2.para: Finishes remounting a mount. If any errors occurred during the operation, error will be set to contain the errors and FALSE will be returned.

entry.para: a GError location to store the error occurring, or NULL to ignore.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the mount was successfully remounted. FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_mount_can_eject ()
refsect2.para: Checks if mount can be ejected.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the mount can be ejected.

refsect2.title: g_mount_eject ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_mount_eject (GMount *mount, GMountUnmountFlags flags, GCancellable *cancellable, GAsyncReadyCallback callback, gpointer user_data);

warning.para: g_mount_eject has been deprecated since version 2.22 and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para:
Ejects a mount. This is an asynchronous operation, and is finished by calling g_mount_eject_finish() with the mount
and GAsyncResult data returned in the callback .

entry.para: flags affecting the unmount if required for eject
optional GCancellable object, NULL to ignore.

refsect2.title: g_mount_eject_finish ()

warning.para: g_mount_eject_finish has been deprecated since version 2.22 and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Finishes ejecting a mount. If any errors occurred during the operation, error will be set to contain the errors and FALSE will be returned.

entry.para: a GError location to store the error occurring, or NULL to ignore.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the mount was successfully ejected. FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_mount_eject_with_operation ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_mount_eject_with_operation (GMount *mount, GMountUnmountFlags flags, GMountOperation *mount_operation, GCancellable *cancellable, GAsyncReadyCallback callback, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para:
Ejects a mount. This is an asynchronous operation, and is finished by calling g_mount_eject_with_operation_finish() with the mount
and GAsyncResult data returned in the callback .

entry.para: flags affecting the unmount if required for eject
a GMountOperation or NULL to avoid user interaction.
optional GCancellable object, NULL to ignore.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.22

refsect2.title: g_mount_eject_with_operation_finish ()
refsect2.para: Finishes ejecting a mount. If any errors occurred during the operation, error will be set to contain the errors and FALSE will be returned.

entry.para: a GError location to store the error occurring, or NULL to ignore.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the mount was successfully ejected. FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.22

refsect2.title: g_mount_guess_content_type ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_mount_guess_content_type (GMount *mount, gboolean force_rescan, GCancellable *cancellable, GAsyncReadyCallback callback, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: Tries to guess the type of content stored on mount . Returns one or more textual identifiers of well-known content types (typically prefixed with "x-content/"), e.g. x-content/image-dcf for camera memory cards. See the shared-mime-info specification for more on x-content types.

This is an asynchronous operation (see g_mount_guess_content_type_sync() for the synchronous version), and is finished by calling g_mount_guess_content_type_finish() with the mount and GAsyncResult data returned in the callback .

entry.para: Whether to force a rescan of the content. Otherwise a cached result will be used if available
optional GCancellable object, NULL to ignore.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.18

refsect2.title: g_mount_guess_content_type_finish ()
refsect2.para: Finishes guessing content types of mount . If any errors occurred during the operation, error will be set to contain the errors and FALSE will be returned. In particular, you may get an G_IO_ERROR_NOT_SUPPORTED if the mount does not support content guessing.

entry.para: a GError location to store the error occurring, or NULL to ignore

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a NULL-terminated array of content types or NULL on error. Caller should free this array with g_strfreev() when done with it.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.18

refsect2.title: g_mount_guess_content_type_sync ()
refsect2.programlisting: gchar ** g_mount_guess_content_type_sync (GMount *mount, gboolean force_rescan, GCancellable *cancellable, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Tries to guess the type of content stored on mount . Returns one or more textual identifiers of well-known content types (typically prefixed with "x-content/"), e.g. x-content/image-dcf for camera memory cards. See the shared-mime-info specification for more on x-content types.
This is an synchronous operation and as such may block doing IO; see g_mount_guess_content_type() for the asynchronous version.

entry.para: Whether to force a rescan of the content. Otherwise a cached result will be used if available
optional GCancellable object, NULL to ignore.
a GError location to store the error occurring, or NULL to ignore

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a NULL-terminated array of content types or NULL on error. Caller should free this array with g_strfreev() when done with it.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.18

refsect2.title: g_mount_is_shadowed ()
refsect2.para: Determines if mount is shadowed. Applications or libraries should avoid displaying mount in the user interface if it is shadowed.
A mount is said to be shadowed if there exists one or more user visible objects (currently GMount objects) with a root that is inside the root of mount .

One application of shadow mounts is when exposing a single file system that is used to address several logical volumes. In this situation, a GVolumeMonitor implementation would create two GVolume objects (for example, one for the camera functionality of the device and one for a SD card reader on the device) with activation URIs gphoto2://[usb:001,002]/store1/ and gphoto2://[usb:001,002]/store2/. When the underlying mount (with root gphoto2://[usb:001,002]/) is mounted, said GVolumeMonitor implementation would create two GMount objects (each with their root matching the corresponding volume activation root) that would shadow the original mount.
The proxy monitor in GVfs 2.26 and later, automatically creates and manage shadow mounts (and shadows the underlying mount) if the activation root on a GVolume is set.
Since: 2.20

refsect2.title: g_mount_shadow ()
refsect2.para: Increments the shadow count on mount . Usually used by GVolumeMonitor implementations when creating a shadow mount for mount , see g_mount_is_shadowed() for more information. The caller will need to emit the changed signal on mount manually.
Since: 2.20

refsect2.title: g_mount_unshadow ()
refsect2.para: Decrements the shadow count on mount . Usually used by GVolumeMonitor implementations when destroying a shadow mount for mount , see g_mount_is_shadowed() for more information. The caller will need to emit the changed signal on mount manually.
Since: 2.20

refsect2.title: g_mount_get_sort_key ()
refsect2.para: Gets the sort key for mount , if any.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: Sorting key for mount or NULL if no such key is available.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.32

refsect2.title: GMount
refsect2.para: A handle to an object implementing the GMountIface interface.

refsect2.title: struct GMountIface
refsect2.para: Interface for implementing operations for mounts.

entry.para: Changed signal that is emitted when the mount's state has changed.
The unmounted signal that is emitted when the GMount have been unmounted. If the recipient is holding references to the object they should release them so the object can be finalized.
Gets a GFile to the root directory of the GMount.
Gets a string containing the name of the GMount.
Gets a GIcon for the GMount.
Gets the UUID for the GMount. The reference is typically based on the file system UUID for the mount in question and should be considered an opaque string. Returns NULL if there is no UUID available.
Gets a GVolume the mount is located on. Returns NULL if the GMount is not associated with a GVolume.

Gets a GDrive the volume of the mount is located on. Returns NULL if the GMount is not associated with a GDrive or a GVolume. This is convenience method for getting the GVolume and using that to get the GDrive.
Checks if a GMount can be unmounted.
Checks if a GMount can be ejected.
Starts guessing the type of the content of a GMount. See g_mount_guess_content_type() for more information on content type guessing. This operation was added in 2.18.
Finishes a content type guessing operation. Added in 2.18.
Synchronous variant of guess_content_type . Added in 2.18
The ::pre-unmount signal that is emitted when the GMount will soon be emitted. If the recipient is somehow holding the mount open by keeping an open file on it it should close the file.
Starts unmounting a GMount using a GMountOperation. Since 2.22.
Finishes an unmounting operation using a GMountOperation. Since 2.22.
Starts ejecting a GMount using a GMountOperation. Since 2.22.
Finishes an eject operation using a GMountOperation. Since 2.22.
Gets a GFile indication a start location that can be use as the entry point for this mount. Since 2.24.
Gets a key used for sorting GMount instance or NULL if no such key exists. Since 2.32.
Gets a symbolic GIcon for the GMount. Since 2.34.

refsect2.title: enum GMountMountFlags
refsect2.para: Flags used when mounting a mount.

refsect2.title: enum GMountUnmountFlags
refsect2.para: Flags used when an unmounting a mount.

entry.para: Unmount even if there are outstanding file operations on the mount.

refsect2.title: The changed signal
refsect2.para: Emitted when the mount has been changed.

entry.para: the object on which the signal is emitted

entry.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.para: Flags: Run Last

refsect2.title: The pre-unmount signal
refsect2.para: This signal may be emitted when the GMount is about to be unmounted.
This signal depends on the backend and is only emitted if GIO was used to unmount.

entry.para: the object on which the signal is emitted

entry.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.para: Flags: Run Last
Since: 2.22

refsect2.title: The unmounted signal
refsect2.para: This signal is emitted when the GMount have been unmounted. If the recipient is holding references to the object they should release them so the object can be finalized.

entry.para: the object on which the signal is emitted

entry.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.para: Flags: Run Last
